intro: Photinia daphniphylloides, commonly known as the Daphniphylloides photinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are attractive to birds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms. Photinia daphniphylloides prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
